intro: Luzula arctica var. typica, commonly known as arctic woodrush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Arctic and alpine regions. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly referred to as the grass family. This plant is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit and dark green, needle-like leaves. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to cold, harsh environments. Luzula arctica var. typica produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, greenish flowers, which are wind-pollinated.
